unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Know Your Rights, Yaar!
normalised: Rental Agreements: Know Your Rights, Friend!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Finding that perfect chawl or swanky apartment in Bandra is tough enough. But before you celebrate with a cutting chai, make sure your rental agreement is sorted! Landlords across India, from Dr. Sharma in Delhi to Mrs. Iyer in Chennai, are increasingly using standardized agreements.
normalised: Mumbai: Finding that perfect chawl or swanky apartment in Bandra is tough enough. But before you celebrate with a cutting chai, make sure your rental agreement is sorted! Landlords across India, from Doctor Sharma in Delhi to Missus Iyer in Chennai, are increasingly using standardized agreements.

unnormalised: What does it all mean for you? Well, your agreement should clearly state the rent (Rs. 20,000 seems to be the new normal for a decent 1 BHK), security deposit, and maintenance charges. Watch out for clauses on early termination – leaving before your 11-month lease could cost you!
normalised: What does it all mean for you? Well, your agreement should clearly state the rent (rupees twenty thousand seems to be the new normal for a decent one B H K), security deposit, and maintenance charges. Watch out for clauses on early termination – leaving before your eleven month lease could cost you!

unnormalised: Remember, legally binding agreements are a must. Don't rely on just verbal agreements! Check for clauses about pet policies (especially if you're bringing your furry friend, Sheru!). Also, the sq ft area of the property should be accurate - no one wants to pay for space they aren't getting! Get it registered, folks. Happy renting!
normalised: Remember, legally binding agreements are a must. Don't rely on just verbal agreements! Check for clauses about pet policies (especially if you're bringing your furry friend, Sheru!). Also, the square feet area of the property should be accurate - no one wants to pay for space they aren't getting! Get it registered, folks. Happy renting!
